title: Teen shot while playing with gun with friends, New Orleans police say
content:
(Alex_Schmidt)
A 16-year-old was shot while he and his friends were playing with a gun early Thursday morning (Dec. 1), New Orleans police said. He was taken to a hospital, where his condition wasn't immediately known.
The shooting was reported at 12:20 a.m. Thursday in the 6000 block of Downman Road (map), which is in the Pines Village area of New Orleans East. According to preliminary information from NOPD, the teen and his friends were inside the residence playing with a gun "when it went off." The teen, who was sitting on the couch, was hit in the right arm after the bullet traveled through his stomach, NOPD said.
Police said they haven't determined who fired the weapon yet. NOPD did not provide more information about the shooting.

This story has been updated with additional details about the shooting. The time has been clarified as well, based on new information from NOPD.
